title: "You Bowled A Carrom Ball": PM Modi Writes Emotional Letter To R Ashwin On Surprising Retirement - NDTV Sports
summary:
PM Modi Pens Heartfelt Letter to R Ashwin Following Retirement

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement from international cricket has surprised fans worldwide. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his gratitude and admiration for Ashwin’s contributions through an emotional letter.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • PM Modi likened Ashwin's retirement to a 'carrom ball', reflecting the unexpected nature of the decision.
  • The letter highlights Ashwin's remarkable achievements, including the highest number of Player of the Series awards in Test matches.
  • Modi acknowledged Ashwin's contributions both on and off the field, including his adaptability and cricketing intelligence.
  • The letter encourages Ashwin to continue contributing to the game he loves.
“Your retirement announcement surprised fans in India and across the world... this must have been a hard decision for you as well.” – PM Narendra Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi's heartfelt letter celebrates Ashwin's illustrious career and looks forward to his future contributions to cricket.
newTitle: PM Modi Pens Heartfelt Letter to R Ashwin Following Retirement

title: Robin Uthappa breaks silence after arrest warrant issued against him in EPF deposits fraud case: 'Had no role...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Robin Uthappa Addresses Arrest Warrant in EPF Fraud Case

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has spoken out after an arrest warrant was issued against him regarding an alleged fraud involving Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) deposits, claiming he had no executive role in the companies involved.

  • Uthappa asserts he was a director due to financial contributions but not involved in day-to-day operations.
  • The arrest warrant was issued for failure to remit dues impacting workers' provident fund accounts.
  • Uthappa is currently residing in Dubai with his family.
“Regrettably, these companies failed to repay the funds I lent them, leading me to initiate legal proceedings.”

This situation has drawn significant attention, especially due to the implications for affected workers and the legal proceedings that will follow.
newTitle: Robin Uthappa Addresses Arrest Warrant in EPF Fraud Case

title: Rohit Sharma hit while batting in the nets at the MCG - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma Injured During Nets Session at MCG

Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma was injured while batting in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, raising concerns ahead of the Boxing Day Test.

  • Rohit was hit on his left knee by a throw from a specialist during practice.
  • He sought attention from the team's physio after feeling pain.
  • The blow was not deemed serious, and precautions were taken to manage any potential swelling.
  • The Indian team is preparing for the fourth Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy, which starts December 26.
“The blow didn’t look that serious, and the physio is taking precaution to ensure swelling, if any, subsides.”

Rohit hopes to recover quickly before the important test match.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Injured During Nets Session at MCG

title: Australian media misbehaves with Team India, spreads absurd lies about Ravindra Jadeja: Here's what actually happened - Hindustan Times
summary:
Australian Media Misbehaves with Team India, Spreads Absurd Lies About Ravindra Jadeja

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: HT Sports

The article debunks false claims made by the Australian media regarding Ravindra Jadeja's press conference, where he was accused of refusing to answer questions in English. It provides a detailed clarification of the events, countering misleading statements and highlighting the rudeness displayed by some Australian journalists.

  • The Australian media falsely claimed that Jadeja refused to answer questions in English.
  • In reality, Jadeja answered questions in Hindi, as they were posed in that language.
  • Another claim suggested Jadeja had to leave for the team bus, which he never said.
  • The press conference was primarily for Indian media, which was communicated beforehand.
“At no stage did Jadeja refuse to answer in English.”

This controversy comes amidst growing tensions surrounding the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, now tied at 1-1, highlighting not just on-field rivalries but off-field frictions as well.
newTitle: Australian Media Misreports on Ravindra Jadeja During Border-Gavaskar Trophy

title: Barcelona player ratings vs Atletico Madrid: Blaugrana’s title bid takes serious hit as dismal Fermin Lopez & Marc Casado let magical Pedri down in stoppage-time heartache - GOAL English
summary:
Barcelona Player Ratings vs Atletico Madrid: Title Bid Takes a Hit

Publication Date: N/A Source: Goal

Barcelona suffered a painful stoppage time defeat against Atletico Madrid, losing 2-1 and dropping from the top of La Liga as they failed to capitalize on their lead.

  • Barcelona started strong but fell victim to Atletico's counter-attacks.
  • Pedri scored the opening goal but Fermin Lopez and Marc Casado's poor performances contributed to the defeat.
  • Atletico Madrid's Sorloth scored the winner in stoppage time, marking their first away league win against Barcelona since 2006.
  • The loss capped a disappointing night for Barcelona, who were frustrated in their attempts to break down Atletico's defense.
“Sorloth emphatically rounded off a rapid counter-attack to break Barca hearts.”

The defeat is a significant setback for Barcelona in their title bid, demonstrating vulnerabilities in their performance.
newTitle: Barcelona Player Ratings vs Atletico Madrid: Title Bid Takes a Hit

title: Watch: Australian Media Baffled Over Ravindra Jadeja's Alleged Refusal To Answer Queries In English - News18
summary:
Watch: Australian Media Baffled Over Ravindra Jadeja's Alleged Refusal To Answer Queries In English

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

A Border-Gavaskar Trophy series is never short of controversies, and this time Ravindra Jadeja has stirred attention by not answering any questions in English during a press conference at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Ravindra Jadeja conducted a press conference, but refused to answer questions in English.
  • He spoke in Hindi about a previous match in Brisbane, leading to confusion among Australian journalists.
  • This incident follows Virat Kohli's recent confrontation with the media over children's privacy.
  • The Australian media's reaction has caused further controversy regarding the treatment of Indian players.
BREAKING🚨The Australian media has unnecessarily targeted the Indian cricket team once again.
The Australian media accused Ravindra Jadeja of speaking in his native tongue instead of waiting to respond in English, which caused controversy at the press conference.… pic.twitter.com/9L5mYm7G34

The implications of this incident highlight ongoing tensions and misunderstandings between players and media, particularly in high-stakes series such as the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
newTitle: Australian Media Confused by Ravindra Jadeja's Hindi Responses

title: Man Utd and Man City 'Table £58m+ Bid' for 'Extraordinary' Star - GIVEMESPORT
summary:
Man Utd and Man City 'Table £58m+ Bid' for 'Extraordinary' Star

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: GiveMeSport

Manchester United have reportedly made a bid of £58 million to secure Atalanta midfielder Ederson, facing competition from Manchester City who are also interested in the player.

  • Both clubs are willing to enhance their bids to finalize a deal before the January transfer window.
  • It is suggested that a player might be included in the negotiations to entice Atalanta.
  • Ederson has been described as 'extraordinary', crucial in Atalanta's successful campaigns, including the Europa League final.
  • He has scored six goals in Serie A and contributed significantly to his team's achievements.
"Man United and City have tabled a bid worth £58m for Ederson ahead of the January window, and could increase it to secure the deal."

This interest highlights the ongoing battle between Premier League giants for top talent in the upcoming transfer window.
newTitle: Man Utd and Man City Compete for Ederson with £58m Bid

title: Trouble For Ex-India Cricketer Robin Uthappa As Regional PF Commissioner Alleges Fraud, Seeks Arrest - News18
summary:
Trouble For Ex-India Cricketer Robin Uthappa As Regional PF Commissioner Alleges Fraud, Seeks Arrest

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has been accused of failing to pay provident fund dues for employees of his company, Centaurus Lifestyle Brands Pvt Ltd., totaling Rs 23,36,602. A regional PF commissioner has requested his arrest.

  • Uthappa has reportedly not paid dues to employees.
  • The complaint was filed by the KR Puram branch's PF commissioner.
  • An arrest warrant has been sought under various acts related to tax recovery and provident fund violations.
  • Uthappa resides in Dubai, complicating the legal process.
  • A previous court ruling had stayed proceedings against Uthappa's apparel brand in a separate cheque bounce case.
"Uthappa was in violation of various sections of the Employees’ Provident Funds & Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952."

This situation raises concerns about the legal obligations of business owners and the potential repercussions of failing to manage employee benefits properly.
newTitle: Trouble For Ex-India Cricketer Robin Uthappa As Regional PF Commissioner Alleges Fraud, Seeks Arrest

summary:
Aston Villa 2-1 Man City Game Analysis

Publication Date: 21 Dec, 2024 | Source: ESPN (IN)

Aston Villa continued their strong performance in the Premier League with a 2-1 victory over Manchester City, marking City's ninth loss in 12 games across all competitions.

  • Goals from Jhon Durán and Morgan Rogers secured the win for Villa.
  • Villa rose to fifth place in the league, while City dropped to sixth.
  • City's manager, Pep Guardiola, expressed optimism despite the team's struggles.
  • Jhon Durán has now scored in three consecutive matches.
  • Phil Foden scored City's lone goal in stoppage time, but it was not enough.
"We are disappointed, it's not good enough," said City striker Erling Haaland.

This victory showcases Villa’s rise in the league and City’s ongoing challenges in a competitive season.
newTitle: Aston Villa Defeats Manchester City 2-1 in Premier League Clash

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: TeamTalk

Mason Mount has expressed his devastation over yet another injury that will keep him sidelined at Manchester United, promising fans he will not give up during this tough time.

  • Mount suffered an injury after playing just 14 minutes in the Manchester derby.
  • Manager Ruben Amorim confirmed Mount will be out for “long,” suggesting a recovery time of several weeks.
  • Mount managed only 500 minutes in total during his last season due to injuries.
  • He expressed his feelings on Instagram, pledging to fight through this hard period and continue giving his all for the club.
“Words can’t portray how devastated I’m feeling right now... one thing I can guarantee, I will never give up or lose faith.” - Mason Mount

This ongoing injury saga raises concerns about Mount’s future contributions to Manchester United and highlights the challenges faced by players in elite sports.

Aston Villa inflicted further defeat on Manchester City with a 2-1 victory, as Villa moved to fifth in the Premier League while City struggles in sixth.

  • Manchester City has now lost nine out of their last twelve matches across all competitions.

The January transfer window is approaching, and some members of Chelsea's squad, including Ben Chilwell, Cesare Casadei, and Carney Chukwuemeka, may leave as Enzo Maresca intends to reduce the squad size.

  • Ben Chilwell, currently earning £200,000 per week, has minimal game time this season.

title: 13-Year-Old Vaibhav Suryavanshi Sets Another Record, Now Becomes Youngest Player To... - NDTV Sports
summary:
13-Year-Old Vaibhav Suryavanshi Sets Another Record, Now Becomes Youngest Player To...

Publication Date: November 30, 2024

Source: NDTV

13-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi continues to topple more records by becoming the youngest-ever Indian player to play a List A game.

  • Suryavanshi was sold to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 1.1 crore in an IPL auction.
  • He broke the previous record of 14 years and 51 days held by Ali Akbar since the 1999/00 season.
  • In his debut match for Bihar against Madhya Pradesh, he scored 4 runs off 2 balls.
  • Bihar scored a total of 196, which Madhya Pradesh chased down easily.
  • Suryavanshi had previously become the youngest player in Ranji Trophy and India U19.
  • He impressed at the ACC Men's U19 Asia Cup, scoring 176 runs in five games with an average of 76.
“Suryavanshi continues to break age-records...”

This remarkable achievement highlights the young cricketer's potential and sets the stage for a promising career in cricket.
newTitle: 13-Year-Old Vaibhav Suryavanshi Sets Another Record in Cricket

Karnataka's Historic Chase in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Karnataka achieved a remarkable chase of 383 runs against Mumbai, propelled by K Shrijith's unbeaten 150 runs, marking one of the highest successful chases in Vijay Hazare Trophy history.

  • Shrijith scores 150* off 101 balls.
  • Karnataka chased down a target of 383 with 3.4 overs to spare.

  • Karnataka's chase is the second-highest in Vijay Hazare Trophy history.

title: Telugu Titans CEO, Trinadh Reddy praises coaches for their role season 11 - vivo Pro Kabaddi
Fresh Injury Concern For India: Star Opener Gets Hit On Hand In Nets Days Ahead Of Boxing Day Test. .. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Injury Woes for India as KL Rahul Hits Hand in Practice Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 Source: NDTV

Indian cricketer KL Rahul faced an injury scare after a blow to his right hand while batting in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). This incident raises concerns ahead of the crucial Boxing Day Test.

  • KL Rahul has scored 235 runs in his last three Tests, averaging 47 with two half-centuries.
  • The Indian team is yet to assess the seriousness of the injury.
  • Social media reactions suggest a collective concern for Rahul's fitness as he prepares for the Boxing Day Test.
  • Rahul is aiming for a rare hat-trick of centuries in consecutive Boxing Day Tests.
"KL Rahul suffered a hand injury at the MCG nets today during practice session. #INDvAUS" — (@rushiii_12) December 21, 2024

The incident adds pressure on Rahul to recover quickly to maintain India's competitive edge in the series.
newTitle: Injury Woes for India as KL Rahul Hits Hand in Practice Ahead of Boxing Day Test
